title: Factoring $$x^2+bx+c$$
text: When factoring trinomials of the form $$x^2+bx+c$$, we get an answer $$\left(x+k\right) \left(x+h\right)$$, where k and $$h$$ sum to $$b$$ and multiply to c
speech: When factoring trinomials of the form  x squared plus b x plus c , we get an answer  parentheses x plus k,  times, parentheses x plus h,  , where k and  h  sum to  b  and multiply to c
pacedSpeech: When factoring trinomials of the form   x squared plus b x plus c
, we get an answer    x plus k,  times,  x plus h,

title: Factoring the Equation with the Given Rules
text: To factor into the form $$\left(x+h\right) \left(x+k\right)$$, we could take $$k=-5$$ and $$h=1$$, because they sum to $$b=-4$$ and multiply to $$c=-5$$ We have $$\left(x-5\right) \left(x+1\right)$$
speech: To factor into the form  parentheses x plus h,  times, parentheses x plus k,  , we could take  k is equal to, negative 5  and  h, is equal to 1 , because they sum to  b, is equal to, negative 4  and multiply to  c, is equal to negative 5  We have  parentheses x minus 5,  times, parentheses x plus 1,
pacedSpeech: To factor into the form    x plus h,  times,  x plus k,
, we could take   k is equal to, negative 5
, because they sum to   b, is equal to, negative 4
and multiply to   c, is equal to negative 5
We have    x minus 5,  times,  x plus 1,
